meanings.definition: spurges: third person singular present of spur
meanings.sent1: He spurges the horse to make it run faster.
meanings.sent2: She spurges her team to work harder during practice.
meanings.sent3: The coach spurges the players with encouraging words before the big game.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker spurges the audience to chase their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the starting gun spurges the runners to sprint ahead.

meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with beautiful spurges of various colors.
meanings.sent2: She carefully avoided the poisonous spurges while gardening.
meanings.sent3: The spurge in the garden seemed to dance in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: The spurge plant stood out like a vibrant painting in the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The spurge's milky sap serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
